description.narrative: The Project consists of the financing of Akcez Enerji Yatirimlari Sanayi ve Ticaret A.S.s (Akcez) acquisition of 100% of the shares of Sakarya Elektrik Dagitim A.S. (SEDAS), the distribution company for the Sakarya region in north-western Turkey, and its capital expenditures. Akcez acquired SEDAS through a privatization finalized in February 2009 where the company acquired 100% of the share of SEDAS for a consideration of $600 million, net of future capital expenditure requirements. The proposed IFC investment consists of a $75 million A loan to SEDAS for IFCs own account, along with a $90 million B loan to be mobilized from international banks.

The Projects development impact is as follows: (i) development of sustainable private power distributors by providing the first long term project financing to a distribution company in Turkey; (ii) demonstrating the viability of distribution privatization to help attract local and international investors to future distribution privatization tenders; (iii) supporting power sector reform in order to move towards possible EU accession and the creation of a regional energy market; and (iv) benefiting the end-users by bringing innovation and improved service levels. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Turkey.

mailing-address.narrative: Özge Özen Aksoy Finance Group Manager Akenerji Elektrik Üretim A.S. Miralay Sefik Bey Sk. Akhan No:15 Kat:3 34437 Gümüssuyu/Istanbul Turkey Email: oozen@akenerji.com.tr Telephone: +90 (212) 249 8282

name.narrative:
SEDAS serves a distribution region located in north-western Turkey, in a highly industrialized section of Anatolia extending between Ankara and Istanbul and covering the districts of Sakarya, Kocaeli, Bolu and Düzce. The population of the region is 2.8 million, accounting for 4.1% of the national population. SEDAS customer base of 1.3 million represents 4.1% of nationwide subscribers, and their combined 2009 energy consumption of 8,414 GWh represented 5.4% of total 2009 nationwide consumption.
SEDASs distribution network has a total line length of 40,491 km (12,864 km of Medium Voltage, 27,627 km of Low Voltage lines), 15 transformer stations (34.5/15 kV), 3 transformer stations (34.5/6.3 kV), 1,156 transformer stations (34.5/0.4 kV), 100 transformer stations (15/0.4 kV), 27 transformer stations (6.3/0.4 kV), 209 distribution center / switching substations (34.5/34.5 kV), and 3,345 SF6 (sulfur hexafluoride) breakers.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
